HERO.TITLE: Where Every Child
HERO.DESCRIPTION: A nurturing, innovative environment in the heart of the city. We blend Montessori and Reggio Emilia approaches to spark curiosity.

WELCOME.TITLE: Principal's Welcome
WELCOME.INTRO: I am delighted to welcome you on behalf of Abad Alshams Kindergarten. We understand the significance of early education and its lasting impact on a child's development.
WELCOME.PREVIEW: To that end, we offer Nursery and KG classes tailored to the unique needs and interests of young learners. Our enriched curriculum embraces modern educational trends and equips children with the skills to thrive in an ever-changing world.
WELCOME.APPROACH_TEXT: What sets us apart is our dedicated team of highly trained and caring teachers. They bring a wealth of experience in early childhood education and are committed to nurturing each child's individual strengths and talents. We believe every child is unique and deserves opportunities to explore, create, and grow in a supportive and inclusive environment.
WELCOME.TEAM_TEXT: We take great pride in our facilities and learning environment. Our state-of-the-art classrooms are thoughtfully designed to provide immersive, engaging learning experiences. Safety is a top priority; we ensure a secure, clean campus where children can flourish and enjoy their time with us.
WELCOME.ENVIRONMENT_TEXT: We employ a play-based approach influenced by Montessori and Reggio Emilia methods to foster creativity and independence. This methodology helps children develop critical thinking skills while maintaining their natural curiosity and love for learning.
WELCOME.METHODOLOGY_TEXT: We employ a play-based approach influenced by Montessori and Reggio Emilia methods to foster creativity and independence.
WELCOME.CLOSING: We invite you to become part of our close-knit community and entrust us with your child's early learning journey. We are committed to laying a strong foundation for your little one's future success.
WELCOME.CONTACT_NOTE: Should you have any questions or need more information, our friendly administrative team is here to help. We look forward to welcoming you and your child to Abad Alshams Kindergarten and embarking on this enriching educational journey together.
WELCOME.VISION_TEXT: To transform early childhood education by nurturing young minds in a loving and innovative environment.
WELCOME.MISSION_TEXT: To provide enriching learning experiences that empower children to realize their full potential through dedicated care and passion.
WELCOME.VALUES_TEXT: Excellence, Inclusivity, Collaboration, and Respect in everything we do.

PHILOSOPHY.TITLE: Our Philosophy
PHILOSOPHY.SUBTITLE: Four key pillars that guide our educational approach
PHILOSOPHY.INTRO: Our educational philosophy is guided by four key pillars:
PHILOSOPHY.CULTURAL_TEXT: We nurture an understanding of different norms, customs, and beliefs. Through cultural events and open discussions, children learn empathy, respect, and appreciation for diversity in our community and the world.
PHILOSOPHY.SKILLS_TEXT: We emphasize critical thinking, problem-solving, collaboration, and communication. By integrating technology and play-based activities into our curriculum, we foster a growth mindset and prepare children for a rapidly changing world.
PHILOSOPHY.GROWTH_TEXT: We encourage hands-on and outdoor activities to support both physical coordination and mental development. Age-appropriate puzzles, building projects, and interactive play help strengthen motor skills and stimulate cognitive thinking.
PHILOSOPHY.EMOTIONAL_TEXT: We promote a warm, inclusive atmosphere where children build confidence and empathy. Through cooperative games, role-play, and daily circle time, students learn to express themselves, manage emotions, and develop self-regulation and problem-solving skills.

PERSONALITY.TITLE: Our Core Values
PERSONALITY.SUBTITLE: The principles that guide everything we do
PERSONALITY.EXCELLENCE_TEXT: We are committed to maintaining high standards in education and operational practices.
PERSONALITY.INCLUSIVITY_TEXT: We celebrate diversity and create an environment where every child feels valued and respected.
PERSONALITY.COLLABORATION_TEXT: We believe in partnerships between staff, parents, and the community to enhance the educational experience.
PERSONALITY.RESPECT_TEXT: We recognize the inherent worth of every individual and foster mutual respect among students, staff, and families.

EXPERIENCE.TITLE: Facilities and Features
EXPERIENCE.SUBTITLE: State-of-the-art facilities designed for active, hands-on learning
EXPERIENCE.INTRO: Our campus offers state-of-the-art facilities and a nurturing environment designed for active, hands-on learning. We maintain large, safe classrooms and outdoor play areas that encourage exploration. Classrooms are equipped with age-appropriate learning materials and technology to support our curriculum.
EXPERIENCE.PHILOSOPHY_TEXT: We embrace a play-based learning environment inspired by Montessori and Reggio Emilia philosophies. This means children learn through doing: they explore concepts at their own pace, guided by teachers who facilitate discovery and creativity.
EXPERIENCE.WORKSTATION_SUBTITLE: Dedicated learning stations for different subjects that allow students to engage in real-life, hands-on learning every day.
EXPERIENCE.ART_TEXT: A creative corner for painting, drawing, and crafts where children express themselves through art.
EXPERIENCE.LITERACY_TEXT: A cozy space filled with books and story props that inspire reading, storytelling, and language development.
EXPERIENCE.SCIENCE_TEXT: An interactive area with experiments, nature exploration, and science kits to spark curiosity and observational skills.
EXPERIENCE.SENSORY_TEXT: A hands-on zone with puzzles, building blocks, and sensory materials where children develop fine motor skills and explore textures, shapes, and patterns.
EXPERIENCE.MATH_TEXT: A fun math zone with games and manipulatives that help children learn numbers, counting, shapes, and basic math concepts through play.

CURRICULUM.TITLE: Our Enriched Curriculum
CURRICULUM.SUBTITLE: A smooth, joyful transition from home to school through play-based learning
CURRICULUM.INTRO: Our curriculum ensures that Nursery and Kindergarten (KG) students experience a smooth, joyful transition from home to school. We provide stimulating early learning experiences that build confidence, communication, cognitive, and motor skills. Play is fundamental in our program – children engage in both child-led and teacher-guided play to explore and think critically.
CURRICULUM.AREAS_TEXT: The curriculum is structured around seven interconnected areas of learning, each equally important for holistic development:
CURRICULUM.PHYSICAL_TEXT: Children strengthen their muscles and coordination through activities like running, jumping, and riding tricycles. Fine motor skills improve with puzzles, drawing, and writing exercises, while games help develop balance and hand-eye coordination.
CURRICULUM.SOCIAL_TEXT: Kids learn about themselves and how to interact positively with others. They practice sharing, taking turns, cooperating, and resolving conflicts peacefully. They also learn to recognize and express their feelings, building self-awareness, confidence, and empathy.
CURRICULUM.LITERACY_TEXT: We build reading and writing foundations in both Arabic and English. Through storytelling, phonics, and interactive writing activities, children develop vocabulary, comprehension, and a love for reading. Our dual-language approach promotes fluency and confidence in both languages.
CURRICULUM.MATHEMATICS_TEXT: Children explore numbers, shapes, and measurements. They practice counting, sorting, and basic addition and subtraction with engaging games. Math activities also teach them to recognize shapes and compare sizes, laying the groundwork for logical reasoning and problem-solving.
CURRICULUM.WORLD_TEXT: Young learners discover people, communities, and cultures around them. They engage in age-appropriate activities that foster awareness of diversity in customs, traditions, and values. This helps develop empathy and acceptance, shaping responsible global citizens.
CURRICULUM.ARTS_TEXT: Through art, music, and drama, children express themselves creatively. We provide various materials and experiences for painting, crafting, singing, and role-play. These activities spark curiosity, aesthetic appreciation, and fine and gross motor development, supporting holistic growth.
CURRICULUM.ISLAMIC_TEXT: Arabic language and Islamic values are integral parts of our curriculum. In Arabic class, children learn the beauty of the language through songs, stories, and hands-on activities. In Islamic studies, we focus on positive values, ethics, and compassion, teaching children to be kind and respectful members of society.
CURRICULUM.STEAM_TEXT: We teach essential life skills (communication, problem-solving, self-care) and STEAM (science, technology, engineering, arts, mathematics) subjects. These prepare children for future challenges by fostering creativity, critical thinking, and independence. Educators address each child's unique needs, building a strong foundation for lifelong learning.

POLICIES.TITLE: School Policies
POLICIES.SUBTITLE: Important guidelines and procedures for our school community
POLICIES.DROP_OFF_INTRO: To ensure a smooth and secure start to the day, please follow our morning drop-off guidelines:
DROP_OFF_LIST: Arrive at the school 10 minutes before the scheduled start time and walk your child to the designated drop-off zone.
Maintain a calm and organized atmosphere during drop-off. Encourage your child to say goodbye in a positive way, reassuring them that you will return later.
Follow the designated drop-off time closely to avoid delays for all families. We appreciate your punctuality.
Help your child unpack any items (backpack, lunch box) and remind them to listen to their teacher's instructions once class begins.
Always hand over your child to a staff member or teacher before leaving the premises. This ensures every child is safely accounted for.
POLICIES.DROP_OFF_NOTE: These measures help create a peaceful transition into the school day for everyone.
POLICIES.HOME_TIME_INTRO: To make dismissal smooth and safe, parents should observe the following:
HOME_TIME_LIST: Be on time: Arrive promptly at your child's scheduled pick-up time. Punctuality maintains daily routines and shows respect for everyone's schedule.

Communicate: If you expect to be late or have an emergency, please inform the school as soon as possible. This allows staff to make arrangements and ensures your child remains safe and comfortable until you arrive.
Authorized Pick-up: Only people listed on your child's authorized pick-up list should collect your child. If there are any changes, notify the school in writing immediately.
Valid ID: The person picking up your child may be asked to show identification. This is for your child's safety and the school's security procedures.
Sign-Out Procedures: Follow our sign-out system at dismissal. Accurately record the time of pick-up for accountability and safety reasons.
Respect Boundaries: Please wait in the designated pick-up area. This helps avoid crowding and keeps the children safe during dismissal.
Courteous Conduct: Be patient and courteous to staff and other parents during pick-up. A positive attitude sets a good example for children and fosters a friendly school community.
POLICIES.HOME_TIME_NOTE: By adhering to these guidelines, parents help ensure a safe and orderly end to each school day.
POLICIES.HEALTH_INTRO: We prioritize the health and hygiene of all children and staff. Our health policy includes:
HEALTH_LIST: Handwashing: Children wash their hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds before meals, after using the restroom, and after outdoor play. We teach proper handwashing techniques to prevent the spread of germs.
Personal Hygiene: We encourage habits like covering coughs and sneezes with elbows or tissues. Tissues are provided and disposed of in sealed bins to maintain cleanliness.

Illness Guidelines: Children with fever, vomiting, diarrhea, or severe cough should stay home. We communicate clear instructions to parents about the symptoms that require a child to stay home until fully recovered.
Regular Cleaning: Our staff follows a rigorous cleaning schedule. Frequently-touched surfaces (door handles, toys, tables) are cleaned and disinfected daily.
Immunizations: All children must have up-to-date immunizations. We keep records of each child's vaccinations and remind parents of any needed updates.
Health Screenings: We conduct periodic vision, hearing, and dental check-ups to identify any issues early and take appropriate action.
Allergy Management: We maintain a list of students with known allergies and work with parents to accommodate dietary or environmental needs.
Nutritious Meals: We promote healthy eating by providing balanced meals and snacks. Parents are encouraged to pack healthy lunches with fruits, vegetables, and minimal processed foods.
First Aid Training: Our staff is trained in basic first aid procedures. We are prepared to address minor injuries or illnesses promptly.
Health Education: We regularly educate children (and parents) about healthy habits, hygiene, and safety both at school and at home.
POLICIES.HEALTH_NOTE: These measures create a safe, hygienic environment where children can learn and play with minimized health risks. Our policies are reviewed regularly in consultation with health experts to stay up-to-date with best practices.
POLICIES.REGISTRATION_INTRO: Enrollment at Abad Alshams Kindergarten follows these guidelines:
REGISTRATION_LIST: Academic Session: Our school year runs from September through June.
Eligibility: Children age 3, 4 and 5 are eligible for admission in Nursery, KG-1, and KG-2. Please provide proof of age (birth certificate or passport) when applying.
Required Documents: At registration, parents must submit asked at the time of registration. Any relevant legal documents (custody papers, etc.) should also be provided.

Registration Process: Registration dates and times will be announced on our website and social media. Parents should visit the school during these periods to complete paperwork. We recommend scheduling an appointment to ensure prompt service.
Class Assignment: Students are assigned to classes based on factors like age, class size, and available resources. The administration may adjust placements to balance student-to-teacher ratios.
Late Registration: If you register after the official period, please contact the school office for availability and any additional requirements.
Confirmation: After completing registration, parents will receive confirmation of enrollment and further details about orientation, schedules, and school policies.
Confidentiality: All information and documents provided are kept strictly confidential, in accordance with privacy regulations.
POLICIES.REGISTRATION_NOTE: Our registration policy is reviewed and updated as needed. Please contact our admissions office for the most current information or any questions you may have.
POLICIES.FEES_INTRO: Our fee structure is transparent and designed for convenience:
FEES_LIST: Tuition is charged on a monthly, termly, or annual basis (as per the school's current policy). Payment schedules and amounts will be communicated to parents before enrollment and in accordance with Ministry of Education regulations.
Payment Methods: We accept cash, Cheques, and online bank transfers. Detailed payment instructions will be provided to parents each term.
Withdrawal Refunds: Parents are requested to read refund policy, which has been communicated separately on the registration form. The registration fee remains non-refundable.
Sibling Discounts: We offer tuition discounts for siblings. Details of any applicable discount will be provided in the fee schedule shared with parents.
POLICIES.FEES_NOTE: Our fee policy is subject to periodic review, and we will inform parents promptly of any changes.
POLICIES.WITHDRAWAL_INTRO: If a family needs to withdraw a child from Abad Alshams Kindergarten, the following steps apply:
WITHDRAWAL_LIST: Notice: Parents must submit a written notice of withdrawal at least one month before the intended last day of attendance. This gives the school time to complete necessary administrative tasks.
Meeting: After receiving the withdrawal notice, the administration will arrange a meeting with the parents to discuss the process and any concerns.
Personal Belongings: Before the withdrawal date, parents should collect all personal items belonging to the child.
Financial Obligations: Any outstanding tuition or fees must be paid in full before the withdrawal is finalized. The administration will inform parents of any pending charges.
Academic Records: Upon request, the school will prepare a copy of the child's academic records for transfer to a new school.
Finalization: Once all steps are completed, the child's enrollment will be formally terminated and our records updated accordingly.
POLICIES.WITHDRAWAL_NOTE: This withdrawal policy is designed to ensure a smooth transition and is updated as needed in compliance with Ministry regulations.
POLICIES.FIRST_AID_INTRO: The health and safety of our students are paramount. Our first aid policy includes:
FIRST_AID_LIST: First Aid Kit: A fully stocked first aid kit is kept accessible in the school at all times. It contains supplies like bandages, antiseptics, gloves, and scissors. The kit is checked and replenished regularly.
Staff Training: All teachers and relevant staff receive basic first aid and CPR training. Regular refreshers ensure that their knowledge and skills remain up to date.

Emergency Information: Each child's emergency contacts and medical information (allergies, medications, conditions) are maintained on file. Copies are kept in the first aid kit and the school office for quick reference.

Incident Reporting: Any injury or accident is documented on an incident report form, noting the nature of the injury, treatment given, and follow-up actions. Parents are promptly informed of any incidents involving their child.

Parent Communication: We notify parents immediately if their child requires medical attention beyond basic first aid. This ensures transparency and allows parents to provide further instructions or pickup if necessary.

Special Conditions: Staff are aware of any chronic conditions (e.g., asthma, severe allergies, diabetes) among students. Individualized first aid plans (such as EpiPen or inhaler availability) are implemented as needed.

Emergency Procedures: The school has clear procedures for emergencies like fire drills, lockdowns, or severe weather. First aid protocols are included in these plans to ensure readiness for any situation.
Review and Improvement: The first aid policy is reviewed periodically. We incorporate feedback from staff, parents, and healthcare professionals to improve our emergency response.
Confidentiality: All medical information is kept confidential and shared only with staff members who need to know for safety reasons.
POLICIES.FIRST_AID_NOTE: By adhering to this policy, we strive to provide a safe environment and appropriate care for every child's well-being.
POLICIES.QUALITY_INTRO: At Abad Alshams Kindergarten, we are committed to continuous improvement and the highest standards of education. Our quality assurance measures include:
QUALITY_LIST: Curriculum and Lesson Planning: We adopt age-appropriate, nationally-aligned curricula. Teachers design engaging lesson plans that meet diverse learners' needs and interests.
Qualified and Dedicated Staff: We hire experienced early childhood educators with the proper qualifications. Staff participate in ongoing professional development to stay current with best practices.
Safety and Security: We maintain a clean, child-friendly environment. Regular safety inspections and secure entry procedures ensure that our students always feel safe and protected.

Parental Involvement: We foster strong partnerships with families. Through regular progress reports, parent-teacher meetings, and school events, we keep parents informed and involved in their child's education.

Continuous Assessment: Student learning is monitored through observations and age-appropriate assessments. This helps teachers identify each child's progress and tailor instruction to individual needs.

Ongoing Improvement: We regularly review all policies, procedures, and programs. Feedback from teachers, parents, and children is used to refine our methods. We strive for excellence by adapting and innovating continuously.
Health and Nutrition: We emphasize healthy lifestyles. Nutritious meals and snacks are provided, and children are taught good hygiene habits. Physical activity is encouraged daily.
Community Engagement: We collaborate with local organizations and experts to enhance our programs. Field trips, guest visitors, and community projects expose children to real-world learning.
POLICIES.QUALITY_NOTE: Our quality assurance policy is shared with staff and parents and is reviewed periodically to ensure we consistently meet and exceed the expectations of our students and families.
